context:
Interested individuals can transfer their existing credentials or credits from another post-secondary institution to programs at George Brown College. The college considers transfer credits for institutions within and outside Canada. To learn more about the transfer process, applicants can sign up for updates and contact ask.george@georgebrown.ca.

Contact Information:
- Phone: 416-415-2000
- TTY: 1-877-515-5559
- Email: ask.george@georgebrown.ca
- Social Media Hub: Visit Our Social Media Hub (No specific links provided)

Note: The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
question:
Title: George Brown College - Transferring Credits and Admissions Information

George Brown College welcomes students who wish to transfer credits from another post-secondary institution. The college accepts transfer credits from within and outside Canada, making it an excellent option for individuals looking to continue their education in a new program or institution. Here's how the transfer process works:

1. Determine Eligibility: Check if you meet the eligibility requirements set by George Brown College for transfer applicants. This typically includes having completed the required prerequisites for your intended program and maintaining a satisfactory academic standing at your previous institution.

2. Apply to the Program: Apply to the program of your choice at George Brown College using the college's online application system. Ensure that you submit all necessary documentation, including transcripts from your previous institution(s).

3. Evaluation of Transfer Credits: After your application is processed and you are accepted into the program, the college will evaluate your transfer credits. The college uses a transfer credit evaluation chart to determine which courses may be transferred based on their equivalency to George Brown College offerings.

4. Communication from the College: You will receive an email notification when the transfer credit evaluation is complete. The email will include details about the credits that have been granted and any remaining coursework you must complete at George Brown College.

5. Register for Classes: Once you have completed the transfer credit evaluation process, register for your classes as normal through myGBC, the college's student portal.

Transfer applicants who are applying to programs with limited enrollment or highly competitive admission requirements may not be guaranteed entry into their program of choice. In such cases, the college will review applications based on a number of factors, including academic performance and availability of spaces in the program.

If you have any questions about the transfer process or require additional information, please contact George Brown College at ask.george@georgebrown.ca or sign up for updates on their website. Note that this information is subject to change without notice, so be sure to verify all requirements with the college before proceeding with your application.

Contact Information:
- Phone: 416-415-2000
- TTY: 1-877-515-5559
- Email: ask.george@georgebrown.ca
- Social Media Hub: Visit Our Social Media Hub (No specific links provided)?
